Package Game

Class Position

java.lang.Object
Game.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class represents the positions inside the game. It implements Serializable interface to support serialization.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAdjacentIndex​(int pos1, int pos2)
    Adds two adjacent indexes to the position for movement purposes on the game board.

    Adds three adjacent indexes to the position for movement purposes on the game board.

    Adds four adjacent indexes to the position for movement purposes on the game board.

    Adds three adjacent indexes to the position for forming a mill on the game board.

    Adds six adjacent indexes to the position for forming a mill on the game board.

    This method returns the index of the position on the game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position​(int position)
      Constructor for the Position class. Initializes the position with default values.
      Parameters:
      position - The index of the position.

  • Method Details

    • isInMill

      public boolean isInMill()
      Checks if the current game position is part of a mill.
      Returns:
      True if the position is in a mill, false otherwise.

    • setInMill

      public void setInMill​(boolean a)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the current game position is part of a mill.
      Parameters:
      a - The boolean value to set for the mill flag.

    • isHasSpecial

      public boolean isHasSpecial()
      This method returns a boolean indicating whether the position has a special piece.
      Returns:
      True if the position has a special piece, false otherwise.

    • setHasSpecial

      public void setHasSpecial​(boolean hasSpecial)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the position has a special piece.
      Parameters:
      hasSpecial - True if the position has a special piece, false otherwise.

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied()
      This method returns a boolean indicating whether the position is currently occupied by a player.
      Returns:
      True if the position is occupied, false otherwise.

    • setAsOccupied

      public void setAsOccupied​(Token player)
      Marks the position as occupied by a specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The token representing the player who occupies the position.

    • setAsUnoccupied

      public void setAsUnoccupied()
      Marks the position as unoccupied. Resets the isOccupied flag to false and sets the occupiedBy token to no player.

    • getIndex

      public int getIndex()
      This method returns the index of the position on the game board.
      Returns:
      The index of the position.

    • addAdjacentIndex

      public void addAdjacentIndex​(int pos1, int pos2)
      Adds two adjacent indexes to the position for movement purposes on the game board.
      Parameters:
      pos1 - The index of the first adjacent position.
      pos2 - The index of the second adjacent position.

    • addAdjacentIndex

      pos2 - The index of the second adjacent position.
      pos3 - The index of the third adjacent position.

      pos2 - The index of the second mill-adjacent position.
